duties_responsibilities.duty: Support end-to-end administration of the company’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) and specific company compensation programs, policies, and procedures.
Work directly with third party administrators (TPA) as needed and support Corporate Compensation and external vendors to ensure customer satisfaction and cost savings across Constellation.
Understand the end-to-end process and may create/design new processes.
Support the administration of the company’s ESPP and compensation programs, primarily long-term incentive (LTI), deferred short-term incentive (STI) and annual incentive.
Investigate and respond to employee inquiries related to ESPP, LTI, and deferred STI.
Support the management of TPAs as necessary and monitors compliance with contractual performance standards.
Support administration of compensation-related planning tools.
Coordinate with Payroll Tax, TPA, Corporate Governance, and others as needed to ensure company legal and tax compliance.
Identify, develop, and implement process improvements to ensure service levels and customer satisfaction is met.
Participate in job audits, analyses, governmental reporting, and surveys.
Identify controls to ensure compliance with applicable requirements and self-audits and monitors operations to ensure controls are operating as designed.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in business administration, HR, accounting, or related field or equivalent.
Professional certification(s) as CCP, PHR, SPHR
